bibl.author: George D. Cole
bibl.title: George D. Cole to Walt Whitman, 13 November [1875]
bibl.orgName: Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p:
I take the liberty to write you a few lines hoping to find you well as I am at present I hope that you will excuse me forefor not writing to you before but you know how it is your self but I write you these few lines to let you know werewhere I am Walt you know watwhat good times Petter and your selfeself and me had together Walt how is Harry my Boy I hope that he is well I have wrote to him severlseveral time and have not
RecevedReceived no answer as yet but you must tell him that you have herdheard from me and give my love to him and take a good share forefor your self give my love to all the Boys on the Rail Road as forefor mr sailor tell him forefor me to go to the and so forth Walt I want you to write to me as soon as you get this you must excuse my writing forefor I am in a hurry tell Harry Parmenter to write to me so good by

postscript.p:
Walt direct your letters to me George D Cole Tottenville Staten Island in care of Capt JW Sprague
how is old car nonumber 29 my old car I have just come from ProvedenceProvidence. we had to put in to new london forefor a Harbor forefor it is a low Blowing a gailgale of wind I am a sailor now and have been forefor a year she is a nice schooner you Bet
